Package edu.northwestern.jcr.adapter.xtf.query

Implements a Jackrabbit query handler using XTF and other query handling classes.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
MultiColumnQueryHits MultiColumnQueryHits defines an interface for reading tuples of ScoreNodes.
NamespaceMappings The class NamespaceMappings holds a namespace mapping that is used internally in the search index.
QueryHits Defines an interface for reading ScoreNodes
ScoreNodeIterator Extends the NodeIterator interface by adding a ScoreNodeIterator.getScore() method that returns the score for the node that is returned by NodeIterator.nextNode().
 

Class Summary
AbstractQueryHits AbstractQueryHits serves as a base class for QueryHits implementations.
AbstractQueryImpl AbstractQueryImpl provides a base class for executable queries based on SearchIndex.
FilterMultiColumnQueryHits FilterMultiColumnQueryHits implements a MultiColumnQueryHits filter that forwards each call to the underlying query hits.
NamePathResolverImpl NamePathResolverImpl...
NamePathResolverImpl.NameResolverImpl Query specific NameResolver that does not assume an empty prefix for the default namespace URI.
NSRegistryBasedNamespaceMappings NSRegistryBasedNamespaceMappings implements a namespace mapping based on the stable index prefix provided by the namespace registry.
QueryHitsAdapter QueryHitsAdapter implements an adapter for QueryHits and exposes them as MultiColumnQueryHits.
QueryImpl Implements the ExecutableQuery interface.
QueryResultImpl Implements the javax.jcr.query.QueryResult interface.
RowIteratorImpl Implements the RowIterator interface returned by a QueryResult.
ScoreNode ScoreNode implements a simple container which holds a mapping of full path to a score value.
SearchIndex Implements a Jackrabbit query handler using Fedora.
XTFQuery XTFQuery processes the query, stores the filter conditions and temporary results on a step by step basis.
XTFQueryBuilder Implements a query builder that takes an AQT (abstract query tree) and creates a XTFQuery object that can be executed against the resource index.
XTFQueryHits Wraps the hits.
 

Package edu.northwestern.jcr.adapter.xtf.query Description

Implements a Jackrabbit query handler using XTF and other query handling classes.

Both the XPath and SQL queries are translated by the Jackrabbit core to the Abstract Query Tree (AQT), the common query description format that allows Jackrabbit to implement a query engine which is (to a certain extent) independent of the query syntax used (XPath or SQL). The "Search Implementation" section of the Jackrabbit website details the implementation of searches in Jackrabbit along with the default search index being used.

The search index in Jackrabbit is pluggable and has a default implementation based on Apache Lucene. The default implementation is independent of the persistence manager being used. To connect to an existing XTF repository, a new search index manager needs to be written to interpret the AQT and generate raw XML query statements that can be executed against the raw servlet of the XTF repository.
